Define the terms: What constitutes a face and an edge in a polyhedron?
Identify the overall structure and characteristics of a polyhedron with an odd number of faces.
Investigate the characteristics of each face having an odd number of edges and understand if this property affects the overall polyhedron structure.
Analyze if each edge can be shared between multiple faces and how it impacts the total edge count.
Determine the total number of edges when summing the edges of each face considering each edge is shared by exactly two faces.
Explore the implications of having an odd number of odd-edged faces on the total edge count.
Summarize whether it is statistically possible or impossible for such a polyhedron to exist based on the constraints and properties analyzed.
Discuss the logical contradiction (if any) arising from having an odd number of faces each with an odd number of edges.
